notes: VPN page peer tables now collapse by default. Click the card header to expand/collapse Tailscale or NetBird peer lists. Peer counts remain visible in the header at all times.

Added self-registration with access request workflow. New users register via 'Request Access' on the login page, enter a pending state, and see a holding screen until approved. Admins see pending requests in Users page with approve/deny/role controls, and a banner on the dashboard when requests are waiting.

Map page now fills full available height with no blank space. README rewritten: NetBird as primary VPN, Tailscale references minimized, irrelevant content removed, feeder beast_out requirement documented.
Login logo centered correctly. Services page: added Restart All Services (soft reset) button that restarts all TAKNET containers with a live status modal.
Login page logo updated to oval TAKNET-PS badge, displayed at 80% screen width.

Fixed web update — git clone and file copy now run inside docker:cli container which has the host install directory bind-mounted, ensuring files actually land on disk. Also added 1s delay before restart to ensure pre_restart event reaches the browser.
Login page restyled to match dashboard dark theme. TAKNET-PS logo added as splash above login fields.
Fixed updates page showing stale 'update available' after web update completes. Version status now refreshes automatically after the modal closes.
Removed LAT/LONG from tar1090 config. Combined with v1.0.41-42 fixes, aggregator now displays aircraft from feeders at any location without range filtering at any layer.
Removed fixed READSB_LAT/LON from readsb config. With READSB_NET_RECEIVER_ID enabled, readsb uses each feeder's own position for CPR decoding, fixing position loss for remote feeders.
Removed READSB_MAX_RANGE limit. Aggregator now accepts aircraft data from feeders at any distance, enabling nationwide and international deployments.
About page now accessible to all authenticated users (admin, network_admin, viewer).

Access control added — login required. Three roles: admin (full access), network_admin (dashboard + data), viewer (map only). Default credentials admin/password. User management page under System. Each user can change their own password via profile menu.
Web UI update button on Updates page. Live log modal streams output via SSE. Auto-reconnects after dashboard restart. Error state waits for user dismissal.
Fixed Aircraft Tracked stat card — now shows 'with position' sub-count. Fixed topbar aircraft count (was showing [object Object]).
NetBird setup key now persists to .env automatically when enrolled via the VPN page. .env mounted into dashboard container for writing.
Fixed NetBird enrollment — added /dev/net/tun device to container so WireGuard interface creates successfully.
NetBird server enrollment UI. VPN page now includes enrollment form — enter a setup key to register the aggregator as a NetBird peer. Status, re-enroll, and disconnect controls added.
NetBird self-hosted integration. Added nginx config for netbird.tak-solutions.com with TLS (Let's Encrypt). Port 443 added to nginx container with /etc/letsencrypt bind mount.
Fixed Tailscale feeder classification. Removed is_private gate that excluded CGNAT range (100.64.0.0/10) from VPN detection.
Fixed Tailscale socket API auth. Added required Sec-Tailscale header to both beast-proxy and dashboard VPN service.
Beast-proxy fetches aircraft data from tar1090 HTTP instead of non-existent readsb JSON file. Fixes 0 aircraft count. Removed unused readsb-run volume and READSB_JSON_DIR.
Added READSB_JSON_DIR to enable aircraft.json output. Fixes 0 aircraft count in dashboard and beast-proxy stats.
Updates page with version check against GitHub, release notes display, and update history log. taknet-agg update now logs to database.
Feeder names auto-populated from MLAT handshake data, overriding default IP-based naming.
Web UI now displays feeder coordinates, altitude, and MLAT status. Feeders list shows location and MLAT columns.
Beast frame parsing for accurate message/position counts. MLAT clients.json integration for coordinates, altitude, and connection status. Added altitude column to schema.
Beast protocol frame counting, position tracking, MLAT detection via shared log volume. Replaced per-flush counters with real message stats.
Time-based stats flushing every 30s. Feeders stay active while connected. Aircraft count from readsb. GeoIP enabled by default. Removed stale host mount for mmdb.
Fixed tar1090 read-only filesystem error. Replaced shared readsb volume with tmpfs mounts for tar1090's internal readsb.
Fixed mlat-server arguments for wiedehopf fork: --basestation-listen/connect instead of --results.
Added required --work-dir=/tmp argument for mlat-server.
Fixed mlat-server Dockerfile — runs script directly from cloned repo instead of pip module. Installs all Python dependencies.
GeoIP auto-download built into beast-proxy image using db-ip.com City Lite database. No registration required.
Fixed mlat-server entrypoint from binary to python3 -m. Corrected executable path resolution.
Healthcheck set to always-pass for readsb container. Resolves dependency startup failures.
Explicit healthcheck override for readsb. Removed service_healthy dependencies.
Switched all container dependencies to service_started. Removed custom healthcheck.
Changed readsb healthcheck from file check to process check. Added start_period grace.
Fixed mlat-server build: added Cython and build-essential dependencies for C extension compilation.
Custom mlat-server Dockerfile — builds from wiedehopf/mlat-server source since no published image exists.
Complete install.sh rewrite. Full validation suite: bash syntax, Python compile, YAML parse, heredoc balance.
Fixed unquoted SITE_NAME causing bash source error. Safe env variable extraction.
Renamed .env.example to env.example for macOS Finder/GitHub Desktop visibility.
Fixed dotfile deployment with shopt dotglob fallback for systems without rsync.
Added Fresh VPS Setup section to README. Installer bootstraps its own dependencies.
GitHub curl-pipe installer with auto-clone. Supports both curl-pipe and local clone workflows.
Removed parallel/cutover mode. WEB_PORT defaults to 80.
MLAT server wired into Docker stack with client and results ports.
Port corrections: Beast 30004, MLAT 30105, MLAT results 39001. Tailscale runs on host.
Detailed README with architecture overview, port map, and deployment instructions.
Initial Docker-based aggregator build. Six containers: beast-proxy, readsb, mlat-server, tar1090, dashboard, nginx.
